item.title: Using Polaris with Keycloak as external IDP
item.description: This example uses Keycloak as an external identity provider for Polaris. The “iceberg” realm is automatically created and configured from the iceberg-realm.json file. This Keycloak realm contains 1 client definition: client1:s3cr3t. It is configured to return tokens with the following fixed claims: principal_id: the principal ID of the user. It is always set to zero (0) in this example. principal_name: the principal name of the user. It is always set to “root” in this example.
